document.masterDocTitle: Barbus anatolicus, a new barbel from the Kızılırmak and Yeşilırmak River drainages in northern Anatolia (Teleostei: Cyprinidae)

Diagnosis.
Barbus anatolicus
IS DIStINGUIShED FROM
B. rionicus
AND
B. escherichii
BY hAVING MORE LAtERAL LINE SCALES (58–71 VS. 51–58 IN
B . rionicus
; 52–58 IN
B . escherichii
) AND thE OUtER MARGIN OF thE DORSAL FIN BEING MARKEDLY CONCAVE (VS. StRAIGht OR SLIGhtLY CONCAVE). It IS ALSO DIStINGUIShED FROM
B. escherichii
BY thE LENGth OF thE ANAL FIN BEING EqUAL IN BOth SEXES (VS. LONGER IN FEMALE thAN IN MALE).
Barbus anatolicus
IS FURthER DIStINGUIShED FROM
B. rionicus
BY hAVING A MORE OSSIFIED LASt UNBRANChED DORSAL-FIN RAY (OSSIFIED APPROXIMAtELY 70–80% OF ItS LENGth VS. APPROXIMAtELY 50–60%) AND NUMEROUS, IRREGULARLY ShAPED, BLACK OR DARK-BROWN SPOtS AND OFtEN ALSO LARGE, IRREGULARLY ShAPED DARK-BROWN, LARGE BLOtChES ON thE BACK, FLANK AND hEAD IN jUVENILES AND ADULtS (VS. IN ADULtS, COLORAtION PLAIN BROWNISh OR WIth FEW IRREGULARLY ShAPED BROWNISh SPOtS ON BACK AND FLANK).

ThE NEW SPECIES IS DIStINGUIShED FROM
B. macedonicus
BY hAVING thE DORSAL-FIN ORIGIN SLIGhtLY IN FRONt OF thE VERtICAL OF thE PELVIC-FIN ORIGIN (VS. DORSAL-FIN ORIGIN ABOVE thE PELVIC-FIN ORIGIN ), 12–15 SCALE ROWS BEtWEEN thE LAtERAL LINE AND thE DORSAL-FIN ORIGIN (VS. 14–17), thE LOWER LIP WIth A MEDIAN LOBE (VS. WIth A MEDIAN PAD EXCEPt FOR SOME INDIVIDUALS LARGER thAN 200 MM SL) AND NUMEROUS , IRREGULARLY ShAPED, BLACK OR DARK-BROWN SPOtS AND OFtEN ALSO LARGE , IRREGULARLY ShAPED DARK-BROWN , LARGE BLOtChES ON thE BACK , FLANK AND hEAD IN jUVENILES AND ADULtS (VS. IN ADULtS hEAD AND FLANK COLORAtION PLAIN BROWNISh).

Barbus anatolicus
IS DIStINGUIShED FROM
B. barbus
,
B. oligolepis
AND
B. tauricus
BY hAVING thE LOWER LIP WIth A MEDIAN LOBE (VS. WIth A MEDIAN PAD ), MORE LAtERAL LINE SCALES (58–71 VS. 53–63 IN
B. barbus
, 53–62 IN
B. oligolepis
, 51–64 IN
B. tauricus
), thE LENGth OF thE ANAL FIN BEING EqUAL IN BOth SEXES (VS. LONGER IN FEMALE thAN IN MALE IN
B. oligolepis
AND
B. tauricus
), thE POStERIOR MARGIN OF thE DORSAL FIN MARKEDLY CONCAVE (VS. SLIGhtLY CONCAVE OR StRAIGht IN
B. oligolepis
AND
B. tauricus
) AND NUMEROUS , IRREGULARLY ShAPED, BLACK OR DARK-BROWN SPOtS AND OFtEN ALSO LARGE , IRREGULARLY ShAPED DARK-BROWN , LARGE BLOtChES ON thE BACK , FLANK AND hEAD IN jUVENILES AND ADULtS (VS. COLORAtION PLAIN BROWNISh OR WIth MANY , VERY SMALL DARK-BROWN OR BLACK SPOtS ON BACK AND FLANK IN ADULtS). It IS FURthER DIStINGUIShED FROM
B . oligolepis
AND
B. tauricus
BY hAVING FEWER GILL RAKERS ON thE FIRSt GILL ARCh (9–11 VS. 11–14 IN
B . oligolepis
, 11–13 IN
B. tauricus
) AND FROM
B. tauricus
BY hAVING A MORE StRONGLY OSSIFIED LASt UNBRANChED DORSAL- FIN RAY ( OSSIFIED APPROXIMAtELY 70–80% OF ItS LENGth VS. 40–60%).

Description. SEE FIG. 2–4 FOR GENERAL APPEARANCE AND
TABLES 2–3
FOR MORPhOMEtRIC AND MERIStIC DAtA. A LARGE SPECIES WIth A SLENDER AND SLIGhtLY COMPRESSED BODY . DORSAL PROFILE ARChED AND VENtRAL PROFILE StRAIGht OR SLIGhtLY ARChED. PREDORSAL PROFILE CONVEX AND POStDORSAL PROFILE StRAIGht. HEAD RELAtIVELY LONG , ItS UPPER PROFILE StRAIGht IN INtERORBItAL AREA , CONVEX At NOStRILS AND SLIGhtLY CONCAVE IN FRONt OF NOStRILS. MOUth SUBINFERIOR, WIth WELL- DEVELOPED LIPS . LIPS WIth PAPILLAE , LOWER LIP thICKER thAN UPPER LIP . LOWER LIP WIth PRODUCED LAtERAL AND MEDIAN LOBES ( FIG. 5 ). ROStRAL BARBEL NOt REAChING VERtICAL OF NOStRIL. MAXILLARY BARBEL REAChING tO VERtICAL OF POStERIOR MARGIN OF PUPIL . SNOUt POINtED. LARGESt KNOWN SPECIMEN ABOUt 400 MM SL (NOt PRESERVED).

subSubSection.paragraph: LAtERAL LINE WIth 58–71 SCALES , 12–15 SCALE ROWS BEtWEEN LAtERAL LINE AND DORSAL-FIN ORIGIN , 9–10 SCALE ROWS BEtWEEN LAtERAL LINE AND ANAL-FIN ORIGIN . GILL RAKERS 3–5 + 5–6=9–11 ON OUtER SIDE OF FIRSt GILL ARCh. DORSAL FIN WIth 4 SIMPLE AND 7½–9½ ( MODE 8½) BRANChED RAYS . POStERIOR MARGIN OF DORSAL FIN MARKEDLY CONCAVE . DORSAL-FIN ORIGIN SLIGhtLY IN FRONt OF VERtICAL OF PELVIC-FIN ORIGIN . LASt SIMPLE DORSAL-FIN RAY OSSIFIED APPROXIMAtELY 70–80% OF ItS LENGth ( FIG. 6 ). PECtORAL FIN SLIGhtLY CONVEX , WIth 1 SIMPLE AND 15–16 BRANChED RAYS . PELVIC FIN SLIGhtLY CONVEX , WIth 1 SIMPLE AND 7–8 BRANChED RAYS . ANAL FIN WIth 3 SIMPLE AND 5½ BRANChED RAYS , OUtER MARGIN CONVEX , REAChING tO BASE OF CAUDAL FIN IN MOSt INDIVIDUALS , ItS LENGth NOt FOUND tO BE SEXUALLY DIMORPhIC. CAUDAL FIN FORKED , LOBES SLIGhtLY POINtED. MANY EPIDERMAL KEELS ON tOP OF hEAD AND PREDORSAL SCALES ( FIG. 7 ) IN KIZILIRMAK POPULAtION, ABSENt IN YEŞILIRMAK POPULAtION. TOtAL VERtEBRAE 45–49 (MODALLY 45). PhARYNGEAL tEEth 5.3.2–2.3.5.

Coloration. FORMALIN PRESERVED ADULtS AND jUVENILES WIth BROWN BACKGROUND COLOUR ON BACK AND FLANK , YELLOWISh ON BELLY . MANY SMALL BLACK OR DARK-BROWN SPOtS ON hEAD, EXtENDING DOWNWARDS tO ChEEK. NUMEROUS SMALL AND IRREGULAR BLACK OR DARK-BROWN SPOtS ON BACK AND FLANK , USUALLY SMALLER thAN SCALES OR AS LARGE AS SCALES . SPOtS OFtEN AGGREGAtE tO LARGE , IRREGULARLY ShAPED BLOtChES. DORSAL AND CAUDAL FINS GREYISh. ANAL , PECtORAL AND PELVIC FINS YELLOWISh. NUMEROUS BLACK OR DARK-BROWN SPOtS ON RAYS OF ALL FINS . LIFE ADULtS AND jUVENILES WIth SILVERY OR BRIGht GOLDEN BACKGROUND COLOUR , PECtORAL AND ANAL FINS WIth ORANGE hUE OR ORANGE MARGIN .

Distribution and notes on habitat.
Barbus anatolicus
IS KNOWN FROM thE DRAINAGES OF thE KIZILIRMAK AND YEŞILIRMAK RIVERS ( FIGURE 8 ). It INhABItS SWIFt FLOWING WAtER, WIth ROCKY AND PEBBLE BOttOM.
Etymology. ThE NAME OF thE SPECIES IS DERIVED FROM ANAtOLIA . AN ADjECtIVE.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks.
Barbus anatolicus
IS DIStINGUIShED FROM
B. niluferensis
FROM thE SOUthERN MARMARA SEA BASIN BY hAVING MORE GILL RAKERS (9–11 VS. 6–8), MORE tOtAL VERtEBRAE (45–49 VS. 43–44), A LONGER (26–29% SL VS. 24–26) AND MORE SLENDER hEAD (hEAD DEPth At OCCIPUt 50–61% HL VS. 60–68) AND A ShORtER DIStANCE BEtWEEN thE ROStRAL BARBELS (8–13% HL VS. 18–23).
Barbus anatolicus
IS DIStINGUIShED FROM
B. pergamonensis
FROM thE EAStERN
AEGEAN
SEA BASIN BY hAVING MORE tOtAL VERtEBRAE (45–49 VS. 41–42), MORE LAtERAL LINE SCALES (58–71 VS. 52–61), A LONGER hEAD (26–29% SL VS. 25–26) AND A ShORtER DIStANCE BEtWEEN thE ROStRAL BARBELS (8–13% HL VS. 19–22).

Barbus anatolicus
IS DIStINGUIShED FROM
B. lacerta
FROM thE PERSIAN GULF BASIN AND FROM
B. cyri
, FROM thE CASPIAN SEA BASIN BY hAVING A StRONGLY OSSIFIED LASt UNBRANChED DORSAL-FIN RAY (OSSIFIED ALONG 70–80% OF ItS LENGth VS. LESS thAN 50%) AND thE LOWER LIP WIth A MEDIAN LOBE (VS. A POORLY DEVELOPED SWOLLEN MEDIAN PAD). It FURthER DIFFERS FROM
B. lacerta
AND
B . cyri
BY hAVING MORE tOtAL VERtEBRAE (45–49 VS. 42–44) AND MORE GILL RAKERS ON thE OUtER SIDE OF thE FIRSt GILL ARCh (9–11 VS. 6–9). It hAS tO BE NOtED, thAt WE FOUND NO EXtERNAL DIFFERENCE tO DIStINGUISh
B. lacerta
,
B. cyri
AND
B. karunensis
FROM EACh OthER AND WE CANNOt CONFIRM thE MORPhOLOGICAL PARt OF thE DIAGNOSES PROVIDED BY KhAEFI et al . (2017) PARtLY BASED ON thE SAME MAtERIALS EXAMINED AS FOR thIS StUDY.
